instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid sensor issue?
threads.message:
MacBook had liquid damage.
Audio board was damaged as well.
I manage to turn it on but got some lid/sleep issue.

When plug charger it turns on.
When I almost close the lid I see display turns off (so lid sensors works?) but when I open the lid it think lid is still closed (no caps lock LED, blank display etc).
When press and hold power button it shut down so power button is working fine.

I replaced twice Audio board with flex and speaker, tried with another power button as well.
I know there is another lid sensor on mic flex (mic in system works fine) and is connected to J6750.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> got correct diode mode values.

It wont turn on when press power button, turns on when connect charger.

J6750 was affected by liquid as well (mic flex has been replaced).
J6750/3 (flex not connected) got only 0.011 in diode mode but when system is turned on got correct voltage 1.8V

Replaced <CHIP>U4802</CHIP> just in case and no luck.

Dont have another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> to fit the board and test.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid sensor issue?
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> got correct diode mode values"
What about voltage level?
Check  with lid open/close.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid sensor issue?
threads.message:
Lid close:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> 0.0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 0.0V

Lid open:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 0.0V

Board only:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> 1.58V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 0.0V

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> got 0.565 in diode mode.

<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4805</RESISTOR> got the same resistance like on another board

Voltage:
<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/1 1.80V
<RESISTOR>R4801</RESISTOR>/2 0.01V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid sensor issue?
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 0.0"
Must fix this problem.

Fast solution: remove <RESISTOR>R4805</RESISTOR> and join pins 1/2 of <CHIP>U4802</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> lid sensor issue?
threads.message:
Thank you very much for that solution.
All works fine now :)
